{"text": "==================================================", "appid": "540840", "steamid": "profiles/76561198122486145", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "15", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1498996800.0}
{"text": "Death Stranding is an odd game to talk about. I loved lots of things about it and I've enjoyed (most of) my time spent with it. I'm giving it a positive review (and I never write these lengthy reviews, so that should tell you something..), but at the same time I can't really wholeheartedly recommend it to everyone. It's different, it's fresh and it's weird - if that's something you value highly then you should go for it. It can also be somewhat tedious and repetitive. You play a delivery guy in a post-apocalyptic world and delivering is what you'll do. It's a pretty cool concept, one that involves driving vehicles and walking - lot's of walking. However, to label this game a 'walking simulator' would be grossly taking it out of context. You navigate the treacherous terrain, balance the weight of your cargo, there's even the weather conditions to be taken into account. There's enough factors here to make your delivery routes fun and engaging.  If making deliveries is not really your thing and you're mostly in it for the story - well, that's when the whole game can feel a bit stretched out. There's lots of going back and forth. For instance, there's times when you'll be making a long trek from point A to point B to point C and then back to A...only for the game to tell you to actually go back to C again. And only then you get to progress the story further. There's also enemies to deal with - personally, I found them to be more of a hindrance than anything else. Thankfully you can avoid them, for the most part. Yes, it takes perseverance to play this game, but I guess that's kinda the point.. The story itself, in my highly subjective opinion, is well worth experiencing. It's definitely 'out there' for most of the time, but it was also compelling enough to keep me going and pushing through some long stretches. The way this story is being conveyed to the player is where it gets a bit difficult. Expect (too) long cutscenes where characters dump a ton of confusing lingo on you, followed by long hologram messages where characters do more of the same and leave you with more questions than answers. There's also bits of lore and story elements buried within countless emails and data logs that you can read. Granted, the game answers most of its questions and clears things up in the last sections, but not everyone will have the patience to see it through.  Death Stranding also looks freaking awesome. It's a visual masterpiece and probably one of the best looking games that I've ever seen. So there you have it, if you're into non conventional gameplay and you don't mind Hideo Kojimas particular brand of weirdness - then you should check it out. There's nothing quite like it. The rest should proceed with caution..", "appid": "1190460", "steamid": "profiles/76561197996148055", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "21", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1598011200.0}

{"text": "Когда-то я брал эту игру по предзаказу. Поиграл более 70 часов, но она наскучила. Раздражали баги, нерабочие квесты, плохая оптимизация и маленькое хранилище. Да и интересностей было не много.  Что изменилось спустя полтора года, после появления игры в Steam?  Стало больше контента. Игра приобрела какую-никакую фан базу. Появились всякие сборки и билды. Новое оружие и броня. Хранилище стало в два раза больше. Наконец-то по пустоши стали ходить люди-НПС. Появились две фракции со своими сюжетными линиями и уникальными наградами. Нерабочие квесты починили и добавили уйму новых. Был добавлен Рюкзак, торговец Легендарками и новые враги.  На мой взгляд, игра стала более насыщенной. В неё на много интереснее играть. Как одному, так и в пати.  76 могут смело брать те, кто не возвышает Вегас и старые части фолыча до небес. Те, кому нравится больше гринд и прокачка, чем сюжетная составляющая. Именно к такой категории я и отношусь. Все эти квесты ни когда меня особо не интересовали. И отличить интересное задание от обычного я редко могу. Всё будет зависеть от того, какую я получу награду, а не от красноречивости диалогов и завихрений сюжета. ИМХО, атмосфера Фоллаута в игре присутствует. Мне не кажется что я играю в ММО, как тогда, когда я пробовал играть в TESO. Тут я получаю удовольствие, а там мне было очень скучно. Минусов у игры конечно хватает. Некоторые баги так и остались. Оптимизация тоже до сих пор хромает. Присутствуют дюпы и глитчи, которые разработчики не хотят или не могут исправить. За их использование вас просто забанят. Если конечно узнают. А могут забанить и по ошибке. Вместе с жуликом за компанию XD  Игра строится на гринде, рандоме и немногочисленных билдах прокачки. Как некоторые шутят \"В Fallout 76, ты либо Полумёртвый, либо Наркоман\" =) Может быть в будущем это исправят. Или легендарные способности что-то изменят. Не смотря на всё это, в игру стоит поиграть. Разработчики хоть и вынуждают нас донатить, но вводят в игру какие-то новшества. Скоро введут сезоны (Ни где же больше не было да? XD) и многие другие вкусности. Можете открыть ПОдорожную карту и посмотреть, что же нас ожидает в 2020 году. Наденьте противогаз или костюм химзащиты. Приготовьтесь к Ядерному Апокалипсису и постройте свой бункер с карточной игрой и девушками. {"text": "Counter-Strike: Global Offensive - shooter en trois dimensions avec une première personne, développé par Valve sur le moteur de jeu Source. CS: GO est une excellente continuation de la série Counter-Strike. Graphics, physique - tout est là en altitude. Je suis sûr que beaucoup vont penser que j'ai écrit un commentaire positif pour le jeu et mon examen sera terminé. Mais il n'y était pas. Passez aux modes de jeu. Jeu 5: normal, Deathmatch, course aux armements, la démolition et la concurrence. Mode normal Classique Counter: Strike - nous avons choisi l'équipe qui va jouer: des terroristes ou des forces spéciales. Pour gagner, vous devez détruire l'équipe adverse, ou pour effectuer une tâche (les terroristes - faire exploser la bombe, et l'équipe de SWAT pour désamorcer la bombe ou sauver les otages). Un combat à mort Le match dans ce mode dure 10 minutes, le but est de marquer autant de points. Les points sont donnés pour tuer ou d'aider à tuer un ennemi. En outre, si vous tuez un poulet, nous allons également donner 1 point: D Chaque arme a son propre nombre de points. La course aux armements Le but de ce mode est le premier à commettre assassiner arme. Pour obtenir de nouvelles armes, vous voulez tuer le chef ennemi ou deux adversaires communs. La destruction de l'objet Le jeu est de 5 sur 5, le but est de détruire l'équipe adverse, faire sauter (terroristes) ou de neutraliser (spetsnaz) bombe. L'arme est délivrée automatiquement. Si dans le cycle actuel vous avez tué l'ennemi, puis le tour suivant, vous recevrez une nouvelle arme Et enfin, le dernier, mon mode \"favori\" de jeu, que je vais décrire dans les moindres détails - Compétitif. Description du Mode: Le même classique Counter-Strike, mais avec quelques différences: Dans ce mode, vous jouez 5 sur 5: avant le match, le système sélectionne 10 joueurs de rangs similaires. Le jeu en mode compétitif, vous ne pouvez pas partir, sinon le système affichera interdiction (de 30 minutes à plusieurs semaines). le feu et les collisions avec les alliés bienvenus inclus. Le gagnant est l'équipe qui va gagner 16 tours. Après 15 tours les équipes changent de place (l'argent est déchargé, l'arme disparaît). {"text": "Неплохая игра от создателей серии игр Crysis. Игровая сессия может состоять из 10 игроков, они могут быть либо одиночками, либо играть в паре с другом например 5 пар по 2 человека. В мире наполненном зомби наша задача первее противника найти и убить главного мутанта, провести обряд очищения и забрать трофей, затем уйти живым при этом не дав себя убить. У некоторых боссов есть особенности, например один может ползать по стенам, другой не восприимчив к огню, поэтому нужно заранее брать с собой нужное снаряжение. Боссы появляются в разных местах, поэтому тут важно исследовать территорию быстрее врага. Также враг может слышать как вы стреляете в зомби поэтому по возможности лучше брать револьвер с глушителем или пользоваться мачете. Сама карта представляет из сельскую местность, леса, болота и заброшенные деревушки. На данный момент карта всего одна, но думаю в дальнейшем Crytek разнообразят выбор карт. Арсенал оружия разнообразен, есть дробовики, ружья, снайперки, пистолеты, динамиты, коктейли молотова. Графику можете оценить по скриншоту ниже, для меня она отличная, даже на средних настройках выглядит безумно красиво.  Итог: Если разработчики доведут игру до ума, исправят баги, и будут создавать для неё контент то это будет одна из лучших игр о PvP + PvE выживание в открытом мире. Всё-таки у них есть все ресурсы, бесценный опыт с Crysis и, безупречно, талант к разработке игр.", "appid": "594650", "steamid": "profiles/76561198161034069", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "5", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1534075200.0}
{"text": "Gud Gaem", "appid": "379720", "steamid": "profiles/76561198035178838", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1561896000.0}
{"text": "Into the breach is a game where you try to save the world from Vek insects with 3 mechs at your command. There are total of 24 different kind of mechs available to play, once you have unlocked them all. You unlock mechs by doing steam achievements and this is a clever move by developers. You should think achievements as quests in this game and those quests usually give some hints how to use a particular mech efficiently. Every single mech have different abilities and playing style varies greatly between mech squads. The game world is divided to four different islands, which are all infested by Vek creatures. All the islands have different ecosystems, quests, enemies and hazards to deal with. They all feel unique and you have to alter your strategies a bit between islands to survive. Unfortunately one island takes only about 20 mins to complete and replayability is not that great because islands plays almost every playthrough the same. I hope we get a few more island as an update or dlc.   You have to clear two, three or all four islands from veks in order to start the final battle. I have to admit the final battle is my biggest disappointment in this game. I don't want to spoil anything so I just say it doesn't feel any epic at all. The basic gameplay is simple: use your 3 mechs with best of your abilities to complete island section's (a mission/level) goals. There are usually 1-3 goals per mission and not everyone is about killing enemies or protecting buildings. There are some great variety about mission goals, but they are island oriented and you repeat same goals many times during playthroughs. Island section is always sized 8x8 square like on a chess board and like on chess game, your mind is the ultimate weapon in this game. Even if island settings feels pretty known after a few game. Every game still feels fresh and fun, because there are some many different mechs with all the different ways you can handle the levels. It's hard to review Into the breach without even mentioning Subset games previous game FTL:faster than light. FTL is my in my mind the greatest indie game ever created period. For that reason my and many others hype about this game was off the scale. Currently Into the breach is no on the same level with FTL unfortunately. This game needs more different islands to play and enemies to defeat. The final level also needs a rework, make it more memorable and unique compared to the rest of the island missions. Into the breach is despite it's flaws definitely a good game on it's own merits. {"text": "You don't get banned from this game (that you own) for altering the settings on your monitor (that you own).  Yay. If you're an old school fan of The Isle like I am, but now see The Isle for what it is (let's not get into that) then Beasts Of Bermuda is for you. Beasts Of Bermuda (or ‘BoB’) is everything The Isle has been promising for over three long years now, and they accomplished more in the span of 7 months than The Isle has in years. In my opinion, the only thing that The Isle has over BoB is the graphics. Apart from that one thing, it's no comparison. But I'll compare the pair anyway, because hot chips aren't the only thing I like to add salt to. The developers of Beasts of Bermuda have had the luxury of watching The Isle make mistake after mistake, and therefore have been able to avoid travelling down the same road. For instance: -The updates are regular and large in size, with many improvements within each one -The developers are extremely transparent and openly communicate with the community at all times -New game features are teased and then actually released -Developers don't p**s away their time by removing old features that you love for seemingly no reason and with no explanation (features that took, I assume, hundreds of man hours to create in the first place) -Old maps that are loved by the community aren't removed for seemingly no reason and with no explanation (see above point) -Developers don't spend precious time and money designing and implementing huge overpowered fictional monsters that only they can control (because f**k the community and the player-base that made all of this possible, right?) -Developers actively listen to the community and act accordingly, based on what their fans would like to see -Lead developer doesn't call his fans \"useless\" or openly say things like \"they don't know what they want\", \"they're idiots\", etc. -Not a single server is run by Anthomnia and his brigade of (some) power-crazed moderators -Community is genuinely a great place to be for the most part If it feels like I'm comparing the two, it's probably because I am. The Isle was supposed to be 'the' dinosaur game, and for a while it was heading that way. But The Isle let me down, more than once, and BoB was there to rekindle my hope for a great dinosaur game.  (TL;DR) Great game with cartoonish graphics, longer you play the bigger and stronger you get, actual benefits to working with other players, massive advantages to nesting and joining herds/ grouping up, and countless other positives – Buy BoB. {"text": "This is a   and   about this game and   that most foxhole veterans think and feel. Also as a foxhole veteran my self and player that has been playing this game from BETA,   and come back after couple of months of taking a break. but i just had to write this review in hopes that one day devs will improve couple if not all of the things i mentioned but many more that i didnt mention but every player will encounter them once they start playing. There are many positive things about this game, but ill mention only 2 that i feel are most important because i am doing a negative review and there are already many positive reviews you can read. 1.  - Every couple months there is something new/different/changed, and its worth coming back and checking it out for couple of hours and then again taking a break for couple of months. 2.  - Meaning you want something done, you gotta ask someone to do it or do it yourself. and yes, EVERYTHING IS PLAYER CONTROLLED, defenses, outposts, town halls, city defense building, bridges, vehicles and fuel for them. i am just waiting for a moment when they will make us repair roads, paint buildings and even implement a food and drink system, so youll no more need to go play farming simulator and instead can do farming stuff and supply food to real players. after all, this game offers everything and you can be anything you want: Medic, builder, miner, driver, engineer, architect, even roleplayer that can take enemy players prisoners, but of course you gotta find an enemy willing to roleplay. -  - 1. With rifles you can see further when corner aiming(i believe about 40-50% more). 2. Big size monitor give you extra 10-20% view distance boost that honestly doesnt sound much, but trust me, its ALLOT in this game. 3. If you add all that and go to a hill, youll gain about 30-50% more view range. so there is no surprise if you see a player base/outpost that your friendly team decided to just go around it and ignore it the entire war.  -  - There are 20+ regions and you gotta drive and teleport in each one to come to the front line. on top of that, front lines sometimes have 10+ queued players and you gotta wait till a spot becomes free, the more players the longer queue, sometimes even 20-30+ minutes of waiting. -  - Entire cycle is 60 minute long, meaning 30 minutes day and 30 minutes night. at night you cant do anything(especially if you in a vehicle because enemies can see your car headlights at all times, but you cannot see them unless they come in range of them being able to throw a anti vehicle grenade and you are GONE), the night should be reduced to 10-15 minutes, because right now, as soon night falls you go afk, unless there is some special \"spec ops\" mission that you and your friends/clan doing, but those are very rare moments. -  - Each war big groups of 20-50+ people switch sides and war is always won if you follow what side they join and fight along side with them. you may think \"well 1 or 2 groups is nothing compared to thousand of players\" and you are right, but when 10+ groups of 20-50+ members change war sides, and all of them are veterans or at least know what they are doing. well you do the math. -  - Levels dont really give you any benefits or advantages, but its always nice to see when someone is a high level, in most games it means that player knows what he is doing. but sadly in this game high rank/level only means you are saving those leveling points to trade them with your friends/clan mates and other way around. -  - If you plan to go afk for short or even longer time(for example go sleep), just hide somewhere and leave your game ON, the next day youll find yourself still in game and ready to go(unless someone killed you and you went to main home page). many players do this because they are to lazy to wait to load into a game and wait for very long queues. -  - There are many players that take advantage of this, because its very easy to set your steam name and that name shows in game, and there isnt anything you can do about it, even devs dont care cause there is no \"report\" system that you can report that. Second thing is the signs that anyone can build anywhere on the map, you build a nice sign that says something nice, 2-3 people upvote it, then you change that sign into something very bad/rude/rac!st and not even 100 players that downvote it cannot destroy it. -  - This game doesnt really need an anticheat because even if you had aimbot, the aiming/shooting mechanic is so \"Broken\" that even aimbot would not help you to hit the target xD also second thing is you cannot even see a player name that killed you(unless you are downed and enemy player comes in melee range), and in order to report him you gotta know what he is using, what cheat and on top of all that video evidence of him committing what you state he is doing wrong. so there is not much point of going thru all that trouble. All the things written in this review(and many more) have been mentioned before and even discussed with devs in multiple occasions. but nothing has been done about many of this things and no plans on changing them. even devs them self said couple of this things i mentioned will never be changed/improved. or one of their popular quotes they like to say is \"thats not our priority\". if \"Unbalanced teams\", \"Tedious logistics\", \"Ghost shots\" and most important  \"Corner aiming\" is not a priority. then i dont know what is. but we are still left with a hope they will maybe one day think about improving/changing how some of this things work or think about them if/when they decide to create foxhole 2 or a similar project.", "appid": "505460", "steamid": "profiles/76561198056784623", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "11", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1589025600.0}

{"text": "На первый взгляд можно подумать, что Evil Bank Manager — это сборная солянка из поверхностно заимствованных идей серий Civilization и Europa Universalis. В реальности ситуация гораздо более удручающая. \"Хорошо продуманный игровой процесс со сложной экономической системой!\" — бахвалится Могучий Зот от мира стратегий. Что же мы видим на деле? На деле первое, что мы видим — вот этот экран.    Должно быть, именно такое впечатление пытались создать разработчики, напихав в один экран несколько раз дублирующиеся кнопки. А когда наводишь курсор на одни кнопки, появляются другие кнопки, и все они открывают одни и те же окна. С этого начинается наше знакомство с абсурдным мракобесием, поджидающим нас в этой игре, которое причудливо сплелось с беспросветной монотонностью геймплея. Отсутствием логики здесь пестрит всё: войну выигрывает государство, которое скупило у нас больше оружия. Не важно, что у него населения в n раз меньше, чем единиц приобретённого оружия. Оно и ясно — вручи солдату запасную алебарду, ему и идти сразу проще станет. Спрос абсолютно неограниченный, они купят  , что вы можете и не можете предложить. К следующей войне всё оружие в стране развоплотится, и мы будем снова завозить миллионы алебард (созданные за пару месяцев благодаря \"накопленной рабочей силе\") призрачными самосвалами, которые провезут оружие от вашей локации через всю вражескую территорию прямо в руки к союзнику.   Вьетнам только что отжал у Китая парочку регионов? Китай поможет Вьетнаму сделать то же самое с Таиландом! После войны настал голод? Цены на зерно подскочили, но не настолько, чтобы его было выгодно выкупить заранее и перепродать сейчас, ведь мы можем закупить ресурсы только по цене вдвое больше рыночной. Конкурентные банки каждый ход будут прилежно загонять себя в долговую яму и брать у нас кредиты (эта механика существует исключительно для того, чтобы убирать конкурирующие банки). И это лишь малая часть того безумия, которое ждет \"самого успешного капиталиста в мире\". Но ведь должно быть в этой игре что-то ещё? Что-то помимо  , затмевающее их, ведь у этой игры (на момент написания) 75% положительных обзоров. Да, есть кое-что, что затмевает всё вышеперечисленное. Это скрипты, которые нагрянут как заморозки, и посреди игры вдруг несколько оппонентов за один ход выйдут на новую ступень эволюции и разбогатеют в   раз. Это не шутка. По крайней мере, ёе пошутил не я, а разработчик. Никаким экономическим симуляторам не сравниться с запредельной глубиной этого изящного и окончательного решения вопроса баланса. Пусть всё это звучит невообразимо, на самом деле игра всё же вызывает очень тусклые эмоции. Потому что по факту из хода в ход приходится делать одно и то же. Это стратегия, которая испытывает навык выполнения механических действий, ведь  нередко будет совершаться ходов по 50 подряд по несколько нажатий. Например, по схеме \"выкупить самые дорогие инвестиции; выдать все кредиты; следующий ход\". В описании игры перечислено столько потенциальных занятий, но по факту, все перечисленные механики присутствуют лишь номинально и являют собой что-то очень однокнопочное, безынтересное и не имеющее ничего общего с симуляцией экономики. Если что-то этой команде умельцев и удалось, так это создать впечатление. Удивительным образом под кратким описанием светится голубая надпись \"Очень положительные\". Правда, большинство положительных обзоров пишут люди, игравшие часов по 5, что, по-моему мнению, довольно показательно. Ачивменты тоже хорошо отображают, какие задачи перед нами ставит игра. В конечном итоге, всё это выглядит как попытка создать  . Вся эта игра такая же картонка, как город на её главном экране.", "appid": "896160", "steamid": "profiles/76561198076437904", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "34", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1595764800.0}

{"text": "Мой первый более менее развёрнутый обзор на игру (в данном случае на Metal Gear Survive). Сюжет берёт своё начало со штурма \"Mother Base\"Большого Босса отрядом XOF, по сути начало повторяет завершение Ground Zeroes, где местами, отрывками нам показывают кат-сцену с проводами погибших при нападении бойцов Big Boss'а. Среди погибших мужчина по прозвищу \"Гудлак\", ищет нашего ГГ, который попадает в параллельный мир после той самой атаки. Над базой открывается портал что переносит нас в видоизменённый мир MGSV - Дит. Как позже окажется, попали мы в него не случайно, а по заданию того самого \"Гудлака\", оно состоит в спасении оставшихся выживших корпуса \"Харон\", и сборе сведений об этом самом Дите. Сам по себе, сюжет неплохой (если принять во внимание то, что делался он без самого Кодзимы). Но подаётся он плоховато, часто диалоги между героями происходят в виде статичного текста, а повествование играется со временем, из-за чего начало местами не понятно. Лишь позже по сюжету всё это объясняется.  Больших изменений геймплей не претерпел, и его \"скелет\" взят из того же MGSV. Однако теперь необходимо следить за состоянием нашего героя. По началу система выживания сильно напрягает, герой постоянно хочет пить и есть, необходимо охотиться, наполнять бутылки и фляги водой, при этом необходимо всё это готовить, или герой будет получать отравление и в самый не подходящий момент блевать (прямо посреди боя). Также помимо естественных нужд, нам будут противостоять местные зомби, именуемые тут \"Бродягами\", которые в будущем будут обрастать другими видами, вроде охотников что ловко и быстро двигаются. Для их аннигиляции мы будем использовать как оружие ближнего так и огнестрельного боя. Из ближнего боя присутствуют копьё, молот, мачете, однако по началу кроме копья использовать что либо другое не стоит, размах у двуручного оружия очень долгий, а бродяги убивают быстро. Мачете и прочее наносят малый урон, поэтому копьё плюс забор, довольно эффективны в начале игры. Касаемо же огнестрельного оружия, вроде дробовиков, автоматов и пистолетов они также мало полезны в начале, из-за отсутствия патронов, однако оно крайне эффективное, поэтому в патовой ситуации сильно спасёт вас. Сбор же ресурсов для крафта и прочего крайне однотипен и скучен, к середине игры он становится рутиной, благо вы уже наберёте довольно большое их кол-во. Помимо сюжета и исследования локаций, в игре также есть оборона буровой или портальной установки. Миссии эти появляются как по сюжету, так и являются частью онлайна (который ныне мёртв). Всё что вам нужно, это расставлять преграды на пути бродяг, и не подпускать их к установке. Присутствует тут и менеджмент собственной базы, благодаря которой вы сможете собирать воду, разводить животных, сеять продукты и пр. В будущем ваша база обрастёт новыми членами, которые и будут вести в ней хозяйство, их также необходимо обеспечивать едой, водой и медикаментами (которые также можно крафтить как и снаряжение). В этом аспекте игра также не притерпела сильных изменений, оптимизация всё также хороша, как и в MGSV. Графика осталась на том же уровне. Metal Gear Survive, мог стать неплохим спин-оффом в отрыве от серии MGS. Но ленивое построение сюжета, нудное и рутиное начало, цена требующая чуть ли не стоимость AAA проекта, сильно ударила по потенциально неплохому проекту. Please try again.」とのエラー表示。ブラウザーから　「Social Club」　にはログインできるのですが、ゲームを立ち上げる際の　「Social Club」 には何度やってもログインできません。パスワードを変更して、それを受け付けたとのメールがロックスターから来て、再度新しいパスワードで試みるも同じエラー表示が出ます。 「Social Club」にログイン出来なくてもオフラインでのプレイは出来るのですが、オンラインでの過去のセーブデータは反映されません。一人でニューゲームでやるしかなくなりました。 ロックスターのＷＥＢサイトのＦＡＱにこの種のトラブルに対してのコメントが有りますが、解決になりません。ROCKSTAR SUPPORTのこんなページです。 ここに記載されていることは総てクリアーしているのにエラーになります。ちなみに同じくGames for Windows LIVE を利用しているバイオハザード5（非steam版）は何の問題も無く立ちあがり、Games for Windows LIVEにも接続出来ています。 私の場合はLaunchGTAIV.exeからの起動も合わせれば150～160時間は遊んだので、もうプレイしなくても構いません(個別に問い合わせとか面倒くさいし）が、新しく購入した方はそうは行かないですよね。コンプリートエディションだと通常は2980円、セールでも以前は596円だったのが最近は894円になっています。それだけの出費をしているのにプレイできない、または大変な作業が必要、では怒り心頭になるのは当たり前だと思います。皆が々、ＰＣの設定に詳しい訳ではない事を考えるととても「おすすめ」には出来ません。「Saints Row」 を遊んだ方がましです。私はＧＴＡ5も欲しいと思っていたのですが、買う気が失せました。", "appid": "12210", "steamid": "profiles/76561198166327114", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "50", "votes_funny": "4", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1480248000.0}

{"text": "Думаю не студия создавшая эту игру , не сам первоисточник послуживший для её создания вовсе не нуждается в представлении , ведь самый высокобюджетный сериал не мог быть не замечен , пусть даже краям глаза , каждым более - менее активным пользователем интернета и любителем эпичных зрелищ в рамках телеэкрана . Студия же создатель самой видеоигры славиться своими играми в жанре \"интерактивного кино\" , жанре который не может похвастаться интересным геймплейем , или продвинутой технической составляющей , что , кстати , не мешает ему быть достаточно привлекательным и популярным среди игроков . Игра \"Game of Thrones - A Telltale Games Series\" , является прямым наследником традиций всех игр студии , начиная собственно с жанра , заканчиваю визуальной составляющей .   Во главе истории стоит один из северных домов Вестероса , знаменосцев Старков и просто дико занудных лесорубов - северян - Форестеров . Собственно все члены этой семьи являются достаточно клешироваными личностями , без недостатков ; готовые всегда пожертвовать жизнью друг за друга , да и за своих союзников , они полностью противоречят менталитету самого сериала , где 99,9% героев по своему характеру и поступкам не очень то и однозначные личности  . Кто - то удивиться : \"Но как же выбор игрока , разве не он должен решать , как герои будут вести себя?\" , а вот и нет! Всё что я хотел сказать этим обзором - в игре вообще нет никакого выбора , есть лишь его иллюзия , с начала  многие главные персонажи кажутся очень сбалансированными , чего только стоит Ашер Форестер , он создаёт ощущение абсолютно хладнокровного наёмника , который плевать хотел на свою семью , но и в нём со временем просыпается своеобразный \"патриотизм\" . Вся игра по сути является симулятором мазохиста , вплоть до 5 - го эпизода у тебя в сердце всё ещё живёт надежда на то , что вы все вместе , соберёте армию и надаёте всем вашим врагам и прочим Ланнистерам  в их подлые рожи , но нет - нелинейность и свобода выбора , как я уже сказал , лишь жалкая иллюзия ! Как человек прошедший игру два раза я могу вас в этом уверить.В заключении хочеться отметить , что игра всё же стоит  к ознакомлению фанатам сериала , ведь много времени она не займёт , вы увидите знакомые локации , повстречаете знакомых героев , будете наблюдать на уже известные вам события с другого ракурса , мда... безусловно над фан - сервисом разработчики постарались , но ко вниманию так - же стоит привести тот факт , что геймплея в ней не сильно то больше , чем при просмотре сериала.", "appid": "330840", "steamid": "profiles/76561198120863882", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "19", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1487246400.0}

{"text": "Richard was a simple minded boy. As a kid, he liked to play video games, he liked that feeling of empowerment when he shot enemies left and right in the latest Call of Duty. He liked to have fun. Life was simple. Then Richard discovered achievements on Steam and his life took a turn for the worse. Now his games had this phallic bar below their titles, and as boys do he wanted it to be as long as possible. But it was often hard to get it fully erect, with no achievement left undone. All he wanted from video games was fun. Life was already challenging enough with a name like Richard after all. This changed some months ago though. Richard discovered that more and more cheap games appeared on Steam that featured a massive amount of achievements. And best of all, achievements you got for basically doing nothing at all! True, those games were not good or fun, but gaming had ceased to be about fun for Richard long ago. He wanted those numbers, he wanted them so badly. And now he could have them, more than he ever dreamed of, with little to no effort! In some of those games all he had to do was press a single key over and over again. Heck, not even press it manually, he just went out into his parents' garden and fetched a stone which he placed on the keyboard. At one time he even had a wet dream about that stone, after a fulfilling day of thousands of new achievements. Then Richard came across Drive-By Hero. More than 5000 achievements made him instantly buy it. And it was even a shooter! He used to like those. Of course the game was utter trash, cheap assets lazily cobbled together, the gun sounded like some stapler gone on a rampage, the gameplay was even worse than he expected. Three levels, one boss. The introductory message sounded like the dev had voice-recorded it himself with a cheap webcam. But he had stopped caring about things like that by now. He just wanted those achievements. So Richard played. His trusty stone wouldn't do for this though: every time he died, he had to press the mouse button to start firing again. He had already played for hours and still was only halfway through firing all those bullets. While he stared and mindlessly shot at the hordes of zombies approaching him, his mind entered a zen like dream state. He remembered those good shooters, the fun he had. After a while, with nothing else to do, he even began questioning the game's logic, how zombies running into his tank could cause him damage, or why he kept staring in the same direction although his tank made a turn. He moved the crosshairs up and tried firing at the full moon instead, to not have to look at the barren monochrome areas or the cheap zombies anymore, but the crosshairs stopped just a few pixels below the moon, unable to ever reach it, and he died too quickly that way as well. Richard fired away at those zombies for what was beginning to feel like an eternity. The image of the approaching hoardes of the undead dug deep into that simple brain of his. Once in a while, a tear would roll out of his unblinking eyes. Ever so slowly his mood would get worse and worse. What was he doing with his life? After a while the zombies and he became one in Richard's mind. Finally, his face expressionless, he stood up, grabbed that heavy, trusty stone and went into his parents' garden once more. It was night time by now, and as chance would have it, a full moon was up, forever unreachable in that beautiful, clear night sky. He slowly, mechanically got down on his knees and raised the stone above his head. With force he brought it down, time and time again. He fastened his grip in determination as the stone got slippery from his own blood. Then the deed was done. The pain was over. As his consciousness faded into the void between the stars, he was finally at peace. This is Richard's story. Don't let it be yours.", "appid": "640310", "steamid": "profiles/76561198059564514", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "91", "votes_funny": "48", "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1498478400.0}

{"text": "*仅为情报性评测 只有菜单汉化，游戏中的海报并未汉化，但游戏中大多是图画示意以及美工会意，影响不大。 继续游戏应该放在开始新游戏上面，对于那些有启动游戏后疯狂回车的不好习惯的人，有删档危险 下面主要说个人游戏流程中遇到的问题，或者说是流程玩法问题 游戏流程还是缺少必要的按键提示，比如接线箱缺少鼠标按键提示，我竟然要用鼠标去点。可能键盘有按键对应接线箱调整的，但是在游戏中的接线画面我没有看到按键提示，我已经过了这个流程了也没有再去试，如果键盘别的按键也可以请提醒我。可能本游戏的首要受众是手机及手柄玩家。挂画、整理床铺以及之后几乎所有的交互物品均无交互提示。可以说这是寻物解谜特色，但是本作光线较暗，可交互物品与场景相比不为突出，对视力不好的同学较不友好。 显示任务提示按键完全没有，只会间隔一段时间出现下一步的图画提示。找锤子工具后找木板这一动作未完成其实可以做成未取得关键道具不能出屋的，对于我这种视力差脑子差的玩家，从地下室踱步到三楼，再从三楼踱步到地下室，再踱步回一楼，突然读回之前的存档（貌似是取了工具再上汤之间略过了取木板钉木板的流程造成逻辑冲突强制读取之前存档）有点略不友好 背对玩家收拾工作台读条我还能理解成找锤子工具，扛起木板还要读较长时间的条，有点涉嫌故意拖时间的感觉。 操作人物走路慢，流程中多次反复爬楼梯经过重复场景，可能会有点审美疲劳。 开门交互设为两个分开的键位较不理解，两者应该互不冲突可以设为一个键的。存档点较少，退出游戏后继续游戏可能会回到较早点的流程较为不便，玩家最好也可以空出几小时时间一气呵成完成游戏。 虽然是类似Distraint单纯找物无难度解谜，但相比之下本作仍有不同。本作的解谜主要是，猜这个怪怎么躲，以及跑&躲流程部分需要一定的多次试错以及刷脸，以及考验玩家之后要找什么东西交互或者是否记得要找什么东西交互。 适合喜欢单纯找物无难度解谜游戏的玩家，不适合找不到交互元素记不住任务目标的无脑玩家 剧情上对个人而言没有Distraint给我的感触那么深，有可能本游戏目前只有二章，也有可能是 我是个笨蛋 和同类型相似题材的Distraint比，Distraint那个蘑菇回廊我玩的也头疼，但是我看攻略也能玩下去，最后剧情也能看的懂 个人还是挺有感觉的，可能Distraint占有文字表达上的优势，而本作初看可能较为猎奇。可能本作还是要细细品味，才能从光怪陆离中领会到其中的真意。 综上，除找物解谜游戏爱好者玩家以及美工内涵探寻者玩家，而且能忍受例如上面所述的游戏的种种不足，再加上看现在的情况完整游戏内容说实话可能是有生之年，并不是很推荐。", "appid": "993990", "steamid": "profiles/76561198149367906", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "12", "votes_funny": "4", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1553083200.0}

{"text": "Like everyone else I had high hopes for this game. Unfortunately GreedFall was huge let down for me. I'm not gonna lie, first 5+ hours were actually fun, I had Dragon Age 2 and other older rpg feels.  But.  Soon after game become a chore and I dont remember when i was so drained out playing a game. If that game came out in early 2000 it would be a hit. For today standards it just doesn't deliver. (I know that this game was made by a small studio of 20-30+ people but my problems were not with graphic or flashy gameplay and action) I cannot recommend GreedFall at almost triple A price. Wait for 50% sale. Cons: - companions. I couldn't connect with anyone, all were uninterested without any ambition or goal and they didn't bring anything to the story. Even after loyalty missions I couldn't feel any connection. Also there were no memorable side characters. - battle system. Lazy and easy. Companion AI is dumb as f**k.  As a mage i was just smashing left mouse click, dodge is broken because it requires no mana or stamina, not once did I block or used any other skill beside Stasis and maybe one or twice that aoe stasis. I have play on hard mode. - character progression. Talents are useless. I have never touched crafting and alchemy (npcs can do that in towns) Lockpicking? From almost all chests you get 1-5 gold, some ingredients and 1-3 ammo, i think there is a chest or two where you find good gear. vigor? Useless. Only charisma and and maybe intuition are worth. Attributes are plain minimum like +100 hp, mana, +10% dmg etc. Skills. Again bare minimum.  - Gear. I have been using Vasco's chest armour from beginning to the end. Every time i got new wep i couldn't feel any difference. - environment. Not gonna lie it looks beautiful. BUT. Towns are too big and that wouldn't be a problem if there were things to explore. They just waste your time. Those 3 houses that you can enter are also huge and labyrinth like just to waste your time. People just stand around like from early ps/ps2 era. - quests. They have drained me the most with all that constant running from one part of map to another just to immediately run back. Some were interesting but that running around ruined (even with fast travel) especially quests where you have to wait for 24h. - conversation. Unlike Dragon age where you have multiple options to chose here you have Charisma answer, bribe or something like threaten/convince. - few types of monsters and copy paste bosses. - some minor bugs and fps drops Pros + Story is actually ok. + Refreshing setting. Not your typical fantasy with swords and magic.  + Environment is beautiful + Game makes you want to play older rpg classics + Not an open world.  Spider studio is on the right way. {"text": "Don't get fooled, this is NOT a souls-like game. Not even close. Yes, the bonfire system is similar, and the rolling mechanic to avoid damage too. But thats about it. The game looks amazing, great graphics and performance. However the maps are ramdomly generated, and the resulting designs are awful. It's basically empty corridors with not much to explore or do but to go forward. Even when you find a chest, the only thing inside is scrap (Money) and materials that you have to pick pressing the action button repeatedly without even minding what the hell you're picking. As said, this is not a souls-like game where every enemy is a challenge. You'll be facing hordes of minions here (defeated with a single shoot most of the time), while from time to time a \"special\" enemy appears, with a sound fx noticing you, and another sound fx anouncing his death... so, the gameplay in-between bosses is really really similar and inspired in games like Left4dead or Warhammer Vermintide. Despite what many people claim, the game is not hard at all, there's only a few bosses that require a bit learning, but nothing really complicated if you are a casual shooter gamer. At least in single player it's easy AF. I haven't tested the co-op, where the difficulty scales, so maybe thats the real challenge, I don't know. Also, the final boss is just boring and really tedious... is a long, long boring fight... Not hard, just long and boring, and you end up dying because you get distracted out of boredom. Don't get me wrong, the game is fun and well polished, but it's not worth it for the current price. Do not pay 40 bucks for this... maybe 15 on a sale in a few months.", "appid": "617290", "steamid": "profiles/76561197998124191", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "20", "votes_funny": "5", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1567166400.0}

А вот уже в Steam от оригинальной карты не осталось и следа...появилась зимняя карта...изменился и метод спавна - выбрал точку и заспавнился (при этом лут спавниться в то же время редко когда соглашался 8) ), появились прикольные фичи согласно карте, типа борда, крюков и личного планера...вьюга, что разительно сказалось на требованиях к железу и ноут у меня это дело тащить отказывался уже...новые механики конечно порадовали, но картина в целом - нет, ведь так хотелось зайти на родную карту и поиграть, а игра уж совсем не та...и дело не в железе, как кто-то мог предположить, играть я продолжил уже за компом, но игра была уже не та - огромное количество растительности, новое оружие, которое, при старой механике, в новых реалиях, отыгрывается и смотрится совершенно убого и неестественно в сравнении с тем, что было раньше.  Может быть всё именно из-за сравнения со стартовой версией, но даже исключая её из сравнения и рассматривая RoE, как отдельный продукт - интереса у меня он уже не вызывает, к сожалению =\\", "appid": "755790", "steamid": "profiles/76561198022952048", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1569153600.0}

{"text": "First of all, yes, this game is absolutely as bad as all the reviews say.  I had to see it for myself.  While I agree with the badness, I also found myself laughing...a lot. {"text": "It's like sitting in a theater in the very front seat... watching this movie. Cutting to the chase, the controls for this game are flawed. They are very sensitive and makes it troubling to be precise during gameplay. Options and optimization are pretty bare-bone, and as a result, you're stuck with very dated and unpleasant graphics and textures. Although I think it is a good kids game for its simplicity, there are flaws that makes this game boring and bland, aesthetically and in design.", "appid": "286880", "steamid": "profiles/76561198055520449", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "29", "votes_funny": "9", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1418644800.0}
{"text": "Only buy this game if it's on sale. This game is not true to the original and it's very short. It has a lot of cut content. We don't have the Restaurant, Press Office, City Hall, and especially Clock Tower or Raccoon City Park. There are some major changes to the story, like RPD segment given to Carlos and Brad's death being reimagined (for worse imo). Jill witnessing his death by Nemesis was an iconic moment in the original and it's not present anymore. Other minor changes that I dislike are: they changed the first encounter between Jill and Carlos, the subway section is at the beginning now, and they removed Barry from the game (he is the one who rescues Jill with the helicopter at the end of the original). But the main problem with this game is that it doesn't feel like a classic RE game and more like RE6 most of the time, particularly in the second half. And it's actually pretty simple to understand why. The reason why the original was so great was because it had (like every classic RE) a crazy amounf of puzzles - in fact the best puzzle in the original for me was the music box puzzle in the Clock Tower, which is no longer present. And it also had many key items that you needed to get in order to unlock previous areas that were blocked when you first passed them. This was also true for RE1 and RE2, which essence were perfectly captured by their remakes. The amount of puzzles and key items in the original meant a lot of backtracking and having to pass narrow alleys multiple times, facing zombies each time. Simple things like going back to Dario's warehouse later on to use the crank and get precious ammo or realizing that Dario actually left his shelter, leaving behind free gunpowder for you. And the fact that you had to backtrack and at the same time run from a crazy stalker Nemesis made that game an amazing and satisfying adrenaline rush. There is NO adrenaline and desperation element with this Nemesis, because you don't have to backtrack nearly as much (or at all), so you encounter him very few times. And I'm only talking about the first half of the game obviously. Because in the second half Nemesis just becomes a dog-looking scripted mess, similar to the Ustanak in Resident Evil 6. This makes me almost shed a tear. Realizing that they butchered the VERY essence of the original game. In most sequences, you can close a door on Nemesis and if you immediately open it again, he is no longer there. It's downright disheartening to realize how scripted he becomes. In the original, he could even appear in the restaurant OR the press office, depending on which location you visited first. Changing not only the fight completely, but also changing how you encountered Carlos for the first time (and if i remember correctly, even changing his dialogue with Jill). This critique has been given a million times, but I'd like to reinforce it. Not only the game lacks backtracking and puzzles (in fact it has only ONE real puzzle: the vaccine puzzle in the last segment), it takes even a step further and completely blocks certain areas from being revisited via scripted events. For example: once you enter the subway station after reactivating the subway system, JIll will roll down the metal shutter, making the city completely inaccessible and FORCING you to move to the subway, even if you forgot some items behind. Not that it makes any difference in this game anyway, since there are no key items that you absolutely need to get to solve puzzles or unlock areas. But nonetheless it's a very clear way to force a linear path for the player, which goes ABSOLUTELY against the essence of the original (or any classic RE for that matter). The area that feels most like Resident Evil is the hospital. Especially in the Intense or Nightmare difficulties. Tight corridors teeming with all sorts of real threats, TONS of backtracking and key items that need to be obtained in order to unlock rooms. Funnily enough though, the worst part of the game is actually at the end of this hospital act, when there's (no joke) a HORDE gameplay where you need to hold your ground during a timer, spamming ammo and throwing grenades. This is SO Resident Evil 6 that I really question myself if Capcom actually learned their lesson. I also want to express my frustration about how this game feels like an insane wasted opportunity. Let's take a moment here and realize that the 3rd game is the final act for the iconic Raccoon City trilogy and could be so much bigger and groundbreaking. Granted, the original RE3 was designed at first to be a spin-off and had a very smaller team plus lower budget, thus resulting in a product that had a slightly smaller scope than the previous title (although, looking back, not as much as people usually say). But this is precisely what gave Capcom the opportunity to surpass everyone's expectations for this game, making an epic final act for the trilogy. Like, cmon, this is THE game that takes place in the streets of Raccoon City. They could have made the city so big and scary to explore. Rather, Capcom not only didn't expand Raccoon City, they made it linear and therefore it feels significantly smaller than the older version. So, to sum it up: The reason why this game fails as a remake is not only the cut content, but also (and mainly) the fact that its essence was lost. IMO if Capcom wanted to have all this creative freedom, then they could just apply it to RE8 (RE7 was a great game btw) instead of butchering a classic one. And, of course, let me not finish this review without mentioning: - No Mercenaries mode. RE3 was single-handedly the game that made this type of minigame a staple in the series. - No live action choices . Massively decreasing replayability. - No Ink Ribbon. There are typewritters and chests EVERYWHERE (this is not an exaggeration). - No Blue Herbs. Why blue herbs if they removed the spiders, right? They also removed crows. You can hear crow sounds in the game and they are even present in the concept arts, but removed from the game. Go figure. You can also clearly see this game was rushed when you realize the zombies are basically the same as the previous game (same models) and a ton (A TON) of assets were reused from RE2R, and yet the game is much smaller and less ambitions. Shame. This is not the first time Capcom puts a AAA price tag in a half-baked product. Cough Street Fighter 5 cough. {"text": "PLZ!!!!! i want asia servers because this game very good but bad server on asia", "appid": "506540", "steamid": "profiles/76561198348574881", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1491480000.0}
{"text": "There is definitely something unique about Ferrari Racing Legends, enough that it made me buy it twice. A clever decision would be to mod an existing well established racing game, but...here we are. The reason behind that decision was authenticity, its the history of the brand, the details of the vehicles. Unfortunately this game was a massive failure. Not quite an arcade racer, far from an authentic simulation. In ways it showcases the issues of centering a game around one car brand, especially when that brand is Ferrari. Known for being rather emotional about its cars and imposing limitations on the product that includes them, as if it was entirely a piece of advertisement. From that we get a long campaign with non conventional difficulty spikes, that is absolutely tedious to complete. However in an unexpected turn of events, the brand itself salvage the product,from this developer. Shoddy work from Slightly Mad, driven worse by not being properly tested. An unfinished product with a few annoying bugs and glitches. The overall feeling is that they were confused in which direction to take, only that they would use Shift handling and physics. The presentation on Career mode is on Point. They use it as a celebration of the brand, divided into 3 different eras. It includes some of the most iconic cars and tracks, in Ferrari history. Obvious that this presents them in the best possible light, Seen from looking at the date for each track. Each loading screen has a text box, describing what is going on in each level. Vehicles sound amazing and are properly loud. Cars interior is well detailed and accurate. Damage. They specifically hate the idea of driving a damaged vehicle. Therefore, vehicles are particularly tough to break, and since you are not allowed to drive a damaged vehicle, mostly you can get away with is a cracked front glass, it means a very minimal damage models. It takes talent to actually break the car, i've managed to accomplish that twice.  One resulted in a flat tire, which you cannot see or feel, because it immediately forces the player to retire from the race. The other, i had crashed at full speed against a wall, which resulted in the driver suffering wrist injury that prevented him from switching gears, though the car was absolutely fine. Its the feeble human body inside that reached its limit. At points it goes too far, like tracks have a pit stop, other pilots stop there from time to time, especially in the longer races. However the player as no reason to do so, because it would be nearly impossible to even run out of fuel. The presentation outside career mode. Its one of those things Gran Turismo absolutly nailed. Many games have copied it since then, even Milestone can give detailed information about the vehicles themselves yet,strangely enough a game about ferrari doesn't. The title image is one of you cars in front of a ferrari dealer, thats about it, not the most inspiring location. The full car list, gives no information, other than the name of the vehicle. It even fails at keeping the vehicle module on screen. As it often crops the vehicle as you move down the list. No iconic drivers, which is a missed opportunity, you can tell the driver s where important, for example look at some of the dates on the tracks and the vehicles, pilots like Schumacher where racing at the time, however they are not present in game. I guess if you're copying the same game, Shift is not a bad choice, its their best game to date. Which is not saying much. I thought that one was quite decent, their handling and the physics are not the issue itself, thought there are problems related to them, more on that later.  The graphics are pretty good for the time, but even this is open for discussion because of issues with the settings and unnoticed details. First of all, anti-aliasing was turned off by default. It needs to be on, there's a weird graphical glitch with the trees and it wont even let you see the road. The settings are limited and there's nothing one can do about the draw distance. Worst of all, is that some of the smaller details will appear first. No direction resulting in unconventional difficulty. Ferrari Racing legends, isn't trying to simulate a professional level race, it instead opts to offer the player a series of challenges for each track. What happens is that you never actually compete against the AI ( i will also discuss that one later on) which could be an ok idea, idk why you would need to sacrifice AI, other than maybe the developer wasn't given much time to finish the game. The problem is that they wherent feeling particularly creative with the challanges either. This game is so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ long and it's mostly the same challenges over and over again. It's so long, the supposed reward system doesn't even exist. They can either unlock a car or a track,  not even close to being enough. You will start a level with 2 challenges, and in the rewards section theres nothing there, basically theres no reward for completing the game. It's such a poor incentive to continue playing One could say, cool...i can just skip levels then? the answer is nope. You can start any of the 3 eras, but you cant skip any of the levels, each one is locked until you beat the previous one. I would have skipped the 10 lap races if i could And the difficulty is irregular, if you the challenge requires getting 1st place than its going to be considerably easier than having to beat a lap record, because you would be first regardless. About the AI, well, its brain dead. It is possible that it gets slightly more aggressive in the hardest difficulty. But the changes are very minor Regardless what difficulty you pick, they will take longer than you to reach full speed. It's not that they don't take corners well, it's more than they drive slower. In fact, and this is quite a frustrating aspect. They will try to return to their designated path no matter what. At first it felt the AI drives well, they're just slower, but that feeling didn't last for long. Once you are required to follow the pack and overtake only one each lap, it becomes a circus. When they are going slow, they often lose control, swerve left and right, they brake way to early for the speed their going. That sometimes resulted in me tapping the rear of the vehicle and immediately it just spins me around like i got hit by a blue shell. If they are by some miracle going fast, they often push me from the side, because i was overtaking them from their predefined path. Sure, the game is so easy it hardly matters, but it is frustrating. There's a race during the first era, where you need to overtake one vehicle per lap. It doesn't take 20 sec for 6 of those vehicles to crash into each other. I had to come to a full stop and wait for them to get back on track. This happens every time you do that race, at least on hard, that's how it went. Let's talk about the physics. Which are inconsistent, but mostly broken because of small oversights. well, to begin, every car handles in a similar way. I think the driving was good in Shift, but here, is off putting that you can drift with some of their oldest vehicles, its absolutly ridiculous (good old Shift oversteer). Thats the least of its problems though, its just lack of care or time. Like F1 cars can clip through the ground on a certain angle and at that speed they just hit the ground and fly off track.  Admittedly, because the game lets me, i tend to pass over curbs, means it happens more often to me, and i can see the front clipping the ground. Except i was looking through replays and that happens with the AI sometimes. There is one race that is bugged, with F333SP, that ends before the first lap, so...be creative. SCORE:4/10", "appid": "211970", "steamid": "profiles/76561198113497432", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "3", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1564056000.0}

{"text": "O ponto alto desse jogo é sem dúvidas o gráfico, ele é visualmente muito bonito, com paisagens incríveis desenhadas a mão. A jogabilidade é bastante diferente dos jogos atuais. O jogo é em 2D, mas você interage com o ambiente na 3° dimensão que é feito em camadas para o senhor prosseguir com o caminho, essas camadas maior parte do jogo são puzzles fáceis de montar o caminho para o senhor, mas em alguns momentos você terá que resolver alguns um pouco mais trabalhosos, os das ovelhas foram os mais chatinhos.  Mas ainda sim o jogo não te prende muito no enredo e nem na dificuldade, são uns 15 capitulos em que você pode concluir em 2h ou menos. A trilha sonora é muito fraca, não é muito marcante, parece mais um som ambiente de elevador que você maior parte do tempo nem nota que está lá, mudando pouquíssimo de ritmo no decorrer dos episódios. E a história é bastante clichê... basicamente contá-la aqui seria spoiler, uma vez que o jogo é muito pequeno e faz parte da narrativa descobrir o porquê o senhor está em viagem.  Em nenhum instante há diálogos ou mesmo textos para serem lidos. E através de momentos de reflexão, por meio de lembranças, o jogador descobre o que se passou na vida desse senhor. Apesar de meio triste e de retratar um romance, o enredo em si não me foi nada apelativo ou emocionante.  Aconselho a compra somente se tiver em promoção, apesar de não ser tão caro, tem jogos indies curtos que valem muito mais a pena. {"text": "Unfortunately just not good. I'm sure the performance issues are something that can easily be addressed further down the line and during Early Access you cant really judge them all too much for it. To me the main issues are something that's fundamentally wrong with the gameplay itself. First of all the characters movement feels much too indirect, making precise movement rather difficult even from a standstill which doesn't help the rather dodgy hit detection on buildings. Another problem is a personal taste, the low time to kill is probably comparable to what the modern Battlefield and Call of Duty games call Hardcore mode. I understand some people enjoy it but to me it feels incredibly counter-intuitive when a fast-paced game tries to add depth by making people die quicker. {"text": "The game is a cute, shopkeeper merchant dungeon crawling fiasco. Unforgiving at times but forgiving enough to challenge you. The animations are amazingly smooth thanks to Rocio Gutierrez accompanied by solid sound design from Alex Benet. A shame the gameplay gets repetitive too quickly, but it's to be expected with a rogue-lite rougelike (but the grindfest is just unbelievable - you'll be grinding and dying alot, unless you play slow and safe). The soundtrack is beautiful with it's light accents and whimsical compositions by David Fenn, that gives it a nice light-hearted atmosphere regardless if you're in a death defying situation fighting a boss or trying to build up the town.  Some of the weapon varieties leaves something to be desired, as most are the same with only a different skin and different animations but do the same damage, reach the same aoe/length and barely affect the character. The level designs and enemies favour a certain playstyle, resulting in boring laborious dungeon crawling and shopkeeping. And it always surprises me how the same customer can walk in 7 times in one day to buy 7 things - where does these villagers get their money from? It's not a big town, 15 at most (and even if you expand the town, it still stays pretty small with 1 or 2 new npcs - that are also filthy rich). And hardly anyone ever leaves the town with no travelling merchants that come by. So how is it possible they're millionaires!? There is also nothing to do in town. It's a waste of space. It could've been utilised better had there been more life. Rather than having npcs aimlessly wander around making the town look dead, there could've been more meaningful animations to invigorate the environment and ambience. Putting immersion aside, the game while fun, has a tag not worthy of its price. It's too high thanks to the issues above. Wait for at least a 75% off sale/discount. Recommended because at least I had fun while it lasted. * However, I'm not recommending on the basis that, Digital Sun lost their own keys to re-sellers whether it be their own fault or 11 bit studios, and revoked my key where I bought it lawfully outside of Steam. A shame. Did I forget to mention they removed my key after playing 45 hours of the game? {"text": "Раз Resident evil Resistance идет в комплекте с третьей частью несколько слов о нем. Это асимметричный мультиплеерный экшен, где один берет роль кукловода остальные четыре роль выживших. Задача кукловода одна уничтожить всех выживших наблюдая за ними через камеры спавнить зомби (некоторые идут с разными эффектами взрывающиеся, лежачие, в броне, регенерирующие и так далее), собак, ликеров и прочую нечисть из игры, ловушки разных типов или превратить камеру в огнестрельное оружие, идея довольно оригинальная, но реализация очень плохая. Переключение между камерами долгая и не удобная, спавн идет прям на глазах выживших, что выглядит абсурдно. По праздникам разрешается поиграть одним из тиранов на короткое время, у каждого кукловода (всего их четыре) свой тиран под их тематику, их проблема в том, что они бесполезные Биркин медленный и не поворотливый, мистер икс более и менее играбельный, Тиран в виде растение от Алекс Вескер легко поджигается, а лазерная стенка Спенсера, вообще работает несколько секунд и стоит на месте ее можно просто переждать и толком нечего не потерять, вообще любой тиран можно без проблем контрится флешками, коктелями молотова, гранатами или ракетницей, камеры через которые и наблюдаете за выжившими можно отключить при помощи способности одного из выжившего и тогда вы просто нечего не можете сделать, а за это время выжившие могут сделать все, что им нужно для своего продвижения. При желание можно и самим влезть в шкуру зомби, собаки и тд, опять же идея классная, но реализация ужас, в чью шкуру влез кукловод всегда видно, зомби или другая фауна под руководством кукловода жирнее, а если еще взял под контроль бронированного зомби можно вообще всю команду положить на землю. Задача выжившего сбежать пройдя 3 комнаты, с разными задачами: 1) Найти 3 вещи и поставить на свое место. 2) Найти зомби охранника и взять карточку и активировать три терминала. 3) Уничтожить 3 бака активировать дверь и выбраться. Проблема опять же исходит от баланса, если игроки играют командами, а уж тем более знают карту у кукловод нет не каких шансов, но когда присоединяетесь к рандомам тут начинается полный бред, выжившие начинают расходиться не понятно куда, а если кукловод поймает отставшего игрока считая он труп и один нечего сделать не может, наступают на очевидные ловушки, которые только слепой не увидит и ждать помощи от них не стоит. На данный момент 7 выживших и у каждого свои способности одна лечит и видит сквозь стены, другая выключает камеры, а третья вообще не на долго время появляется бесконечный боезапас, полезно, но хочется, что то более интереснее чем пинаться или драться руками. Каждый выживший прокачивается отдельно, но особого преимущества от прокачки нет, чуть быстрее лечите, чуть быстрее поднимаете упавшего товарища и тд. вообщем нет такого, что бы захотелось получить, более лучшие желание нет. Большие претензии к одно условности это - время, на начало матча у выживших есть 5 минут время прибавляется, если убивать врагов, обезвреживать ловушки или выполнять задачу, но отнимается если вас кусает зомби, попадаетесь на ловушки ( притом время отнимается от каждого выжившие, который попал в ловушку) и если персонаж умирает за это отнимают, больше всего времени. И вот от сюда и исходят проблемы, если команда выживших со связью они быстро пробегают две комнаты и на третью у них остается минут 10 тогда у кукловода нет шансов даже, если он убьет всю команду пару раз. Со стороны выживших часто с рандомами встречал в начале игры, что могут несколько раз наткнуться на ловушку, пару укусят зомби и оказывается, что время уже не остается. Вообщем таймер в асимметричных мультиплеерных играх зло и не нужен. Ну и последнее самое ужасное это поиск игроков,с выжившими все отлично ищется за пару минут, а за кукловода игру может искать минут по 30 и не кого не найдите, для этого нужно в стиме переключить сервера на Лондон, тогда игроки искаться буду. Отличная идея, но с плохой реализации, уберите таймер, сделайте тиранов реально опасными, сделайте так что бы выжившие видели друг друга, хотя бы перк сделайте на это, хоть как то удобнее будет, сделайте разнообразие условии для прохождения. В асимметричных мультиплеерных играх, очень сложно сделать равный баланс и нужно работать над игрой на постоянной основе. Оценка: 4/10", "appid": "952070", "steamid": "profiles/76561198047708081", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1587816000.0}

{"text": "Risen- РПГ с открытым миром. Поначалу играть довольно интересно,так как интересуешься- что же из себя представляет игра, какой в ней открытый мир, хотелось узнать как можно больше об этой вселенной, но ближе к середине игры я начал понимать, что Risen надоедает, играть просто-напросто скучно, и не более. {"text": "Кинетическая новелла малого размера (1,5 часа чтения), повествующая о 14-летней девочке по имени Олеся (Амелия), и о её нелёгкой жизни в подростковый период. Вас ожидают любовь, предательства, боль, расставания, слёзы, вредные учителя и предки, которые ваще не шарят в жизни ранимого подростка. По конкретике больше и не скажешь, перейдём к мнению. \"Я уже говорил тебе, что такое пустой сюжет, а?  Пустой сюжет - это когда ты берешь самую обыкновенную ванильную историю и повествуешь её настолько душным образом, что читателю совершенно похеp на происходящее с героями новеллы. Герои страдают, теряют близких, плачут, переживают, а читателю всё равно похеp. И всё потому, что ты не стал разворачивать сюжет, не стал прописывать окружение новеллы и вкладывать в характеры персонажей что-то оригинальное, вместо лепки шаблонов. Когда впервые такое прочитал, не помню, кто издал эту хрень, дочитав новеллу, я одобрил её. Смысл в том, хе-хе-хе... Это была ошибка. И после этого, во многих новеллах, я стал замечать это, почти везде, куда ни глянь, почти все разработчики низкобюджеток делают точно одно и тоже, и снова, и снова, и снова, и снова и думают, \"сейчас я нарублю бабла с игры, сейчас всё изменится\". Смысл в том, я уже такое читал, и я не ё*нутый. Это как вода под мостом. Я уже говорил тебе, что такое пустой сюжет?\" (\"Далёкий крик\", Kertycal ©) Ну, а если без шуток, то сюжет действительно никакой. + Мало того, что он пустой, так и в повествовании сплошные ошибки. Герои ошибаются в именах, ошибаются в мелочах, что никак не помогает рваному повествованию. Но и это не конец минусам, сама подача текста сделана совершенно странным образом: \"Олеся, я хотел спросить у тебя домашнее задание\".  Одно предложение, раскинутое на три текстовых окна, с учётом, что весь текст мог поместиться в одном. Я не понимаю, зачем так было сделано... Может, чтобы визуально увеличить новеллу...  Сам сюжет до мозга костей ванильный и вообще, в какой реальности может быть столько \"прекрасных\" совпадений?! Я не знаю, кому такое может понравится. Может девушкам? Ибо, новелла, в большей степени, рассчитана на женскую аудиторию. Хотя... нет, очень сомневаюсь. В общем, подведу к тому, что сюжет плох, как по смыслу, так и по подаче. К деталям. 4 ГБ оперативки, 2 ГБ видеопамяти и 400 МБ места на диске - именно такие минимальные параметры, по заявлению разработчиков, должны быть у ПК, чтобы он запустил ЭТО. Я даже несколько раз сверился со скриншотами в магазине и начал беспокоиться, что окончательно пpосрал своё зрение, просиживая жизнь за компьютером. Но нет, всё было написано правильно. Я не знаю, что будет, если запустить игру на ПК, который слабее требований, но скорее всего, она просто запуститься, ибо там банально нечему нагружать систему.  Визуальная часть на уровне художеств третьеклассника - персонажи мыльные и кривые, фоны такие же. По количеству: 4-5 фонов, 0 CG. Ах, и ещё, игру нельзя развернуть на полный экран (а ведь я так хотел насладиться \"качественной графикой\"). Про музыкальную и звуковую часть говорить нет смысла: отдельных звуков нет, а по музыке в игре 3-4 монотонных композиции.  По мелочам, хорошего ничего нет. А среди плохого: трудности с перемоткой, зависший экран в конце прохождения, смысловые и орфографические ошибки. \"Красивое музыкальное сопровождение, качественная графика и необычная история. Которую лучше увидеть своими глазами...\" - таково описание данной игры в Steam. Жаль, что ни одного из этих параметров увидеть лично не удалось (может это описание совершенно другой новеллы?), как и хоть какого-нибудь достойного плюса этой игры, которая, на секундочку, ПЛАТНАЯ. Засим, отрицательный отзыв с рекомендацией о воздержании от чтения данной новеллы.", "appid": "916710", "steamid": "profiles/76561198152343331", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "14", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1565438400.0}

{"text": "As much as I like the zombies mode, I would have to say that this game really isn't worth the $60 they're asking for it and the season pass isn't worth it either.            I could talk about how good the campaign is, but lets be perfectly honest here. Most people are buying Call of Duty games for the multiplayer and this one does not feel good at all. After coming from Black Ops 3 where the movement system, while not the most favorable, was extremely fluent and easy to use Infinite Warfare feels slow and sluggish. The movement system honestly feels like a cheap rip off. It feels extremely slow and clunky and is just not at all fun to play with.     Zombies is a fun game mode in this game. It reminds me alot of how Call of Duty:World at War was in terms of how meleeing works and what happens if the player gets too close to them. The perks and the pack-a-punch are all pretty much the same as Treyarch's but I am not going to fault them for that because of the old saying,\"If it ain't broke don't fix it.\" That's not to say that they haven't tweeked certain perks to make them a little bit better. An example would be how Stamin-Up's counter part Rancin' Stripes does what Stamin-Up did but also acts as the Gung-Ho perk allow players to throw grenade, pick up items and shoot while sprinting. The power-ups are also the same as Treyarch how ever they have added in special backpacks that drop various items such as different grenade types. Everything has it's place and once you get use to everything the game mode really starts to become fun.      I saved the supply drops for last because unlike previous games it doesn't just impact the multiplayer side anymore. The biggest positive is free guns when they get added. In multiplayer you complete a special challenge and in zombies you simply pick it up. The supply drops biggest flaw is the fact that if a player has the ability to spend real money they will simply be able to progress through the prototype lab at a much faster rate than those who can't, which gives them an unfair edge in multiplayer. On the other side of this \"coin\" is the fact that zombies is a co-op game where players work together to achieve a goal whether it be high rounds or to complete the easter egg on any of the maps. If a player has damage increasing epic weapon then in the long run it helps the entire team because that player will be able to kill more zombies and take a bit of pressure off of their team mates. {"text": "Deus Ex: The Fall is a prequel to Deus Ex: Human Revolution, an amazing game. It has the same setting like HR and does an admirable job at the dystopian cyberpunk the series is known for. Unfortunately this is only a port from iOS and that effects on the gameplay.  You play as Ben Saxon who is trying to find the truth behind the drug conspiracy because they are very rare and all people with augmentations need them. He was betrayed from his employer, a private Military – the tyrants. Now his life and all augmented people are in danger. The story part is nothing much and not really deep.  The gameplay is the same as in Deus Ex: HR, Ben Saxon has the same augments and abilities as Adam Jensen. You need to hack objects like locked door, are able to do takedowns, crawl through vents and shoot form cover. Next to the Main missions you can talk to NPC’s and maybe they give you a side mission and/or explore the world. You upgrade your augmentations and weapons while you playing stealth or kill anyone. As I said, this is a port from a tablet and this is a big problem. On the tablet it’s nice to play this game but the controls on a PC are terrible. They are clunky, unresponsive and the combat from cover is useless. What is very annoying is the fact, that bodies disable after a few seconds and you have many loading times. Just a terrible port. By the way there is an ingame store which allows you to buy ammo and gear every time. That’s unrealistic and too easy. You can shoot all enemies down like Rambo, you only need enough money. For a mobile game its impressive but on the PC it’s not very well, it looks often very ugly. The textures look a bit weak but with the lights and shadows it’s okay. The User Interface is without a Touchscreen just terrible. It’s so annoying and uncomfortable to navigate with mouse and keyboard in Deus Ex: The Fall. The best part of the game is the Soundtrack form Michael McCann which create the amazing Soundtrack for Human Revolution. The voice acting is okay but nothing special. Deus Ex: The Fall on Steam is for fans only. If you like Human Revolution, you can try it but don’t expect a game like this. It's not a bad game but I can't recommend it, it has too much negative points. It’s a game for tablets and not for the PC, note that. If you are a hardcore fan of the franchise, than go for it. {"text": "infelizmente, terei que NÃO RECOMENDAR esse jogo. Leia o porque abaixo: Durante toda a jogatina, não achei muitos bugs que impedissem que continuar jogando, porem, logo após o capitulo \"City of the Dead\", tem uma cutscene em que da um CRASH, e você é obrigado a passar por essa cutscene. O que mais melhorou mesmo foram os efeitos em si, tem mais iluminação.. Mas é só por ai mesmo. Não acompanhei muito a historia,  O jogo em si, É PURO PUZZLE (fáceis por sinal). É muito   (leia na voz de Michael Scott), é literamente muito mais que o primeiro, que mistura ação e puzzle. Mas nesse aqui não, tem MUITA POUCA ação e MUITO PUZZLE. Acho que isso foi um erro bem grotesco para a serie (Espero que não se repita no 3, que não joguei ainda). Essa foi uma das coisas em que eu gostei desse jogo, melhorou muito do primeiro para o segundo. Adicionaram mais elementos RPG e mais SKILLS, com mais combinações que tambem são essenciais para voce aprender. A câmera não atrapalha também.
